name: coralogix
label: Coralogix
description: Coralogix is a modern log analytics platform that provides real-time insights and monitoring for your log data. It offers advanced indexing, querying, and visualization capabilities, enabling users to efficiently manage and analyze log data from various sources. With features such as anomaly detection, alerting, and machine learning-powered insights, Coralogix helps organizations enhance their observability, troubleshoot issues faster, and improve overall system performance and security.

fields.title: Server API URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: Specify the URL of the Coralogix server to connect and perform automated operations. For example, https://api.app.coralogix.in
fields.tooltip: Specify the URL of the Coralogix server to connect and perform automated operations

fields.title: API Key
fields.name: api_key
fields.description: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform automated operations. For more information, see https://coralogix.com/docs/api-keys
fields.tooltip: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform automated operations. For more information, see connector documentation.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.tooltip: Select this option to verify the SSL certificate for the server.
fields.description: Select this option to verify the SSL certificate for the server. By default, this option is enabled.

operations.title: Search Archived Logs
operations.description: Retrieves indexed and archived logs using specified DataPrime or Lucene query.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Specify the DataPrime or Lucene query query to filter the archived logs. For example, source logs | limit 100
parameters.tooltip: Specify the DataPrime or Lucene query query to filter the archived logs.

parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Specify the starting date and time for retrieving the archived logs. Note: The maximum time range allowed for OpenSearch is 192 hours, which is 8 days.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the starting date and time for retrieving the archived logs. Note: The maximum time range allowed for OpenSearch is 192 hours, which is 8 days.

parameters.title: End Date
parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Specify the ending date and time for retrieving the archived logs. Note: The maximum time range allowed for OpenSearch is 192 hours, which is 8 days.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ending date and time for retrieving the archived logs. Note: The maximum time range allowed for OpenSearch is 192 hours, which is 8 days.

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Specify the metadata for the query to be executed to filter the archived logs.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the metadata for the query to be executed to filter the archived logs.
